page.title: 01SOUTH OF SALISBURY
page.content: The land rises from the{Avon Valley} to a broad ridge of chalk downland, then drops to the Ebble valley. Mostly farmland, some deciduous woodland, a few isolated farmhouses. Residence concentrated mainly in Harnham, now a suburb of Salisbury, Britford and the compact Ebble villages of Nunton, Odstock and Homington. Main buildings; Odstock hospital on the ridge, Petersfinger Sewage Farm beside the Avon. Main roads to the South cross paths and ancient trackways. There are 5 churches, 2 chapels. Harnham, Britford, Odstock have primary schools. On the ridge a permanent gipsy site. Historical sites include an{Iron Age Farmstead, Saxon remains {in churches, Saxon burials, Alderbury {Union Workhouse.}
